Context:
The George Brown College Public Safety and Security Division is made up of 24/7 on-duty security professionals monitoring and patrolling over 1.9 million square feet of college buildings. There are surveillance cameras located throughout the premises. All Security guards are trained in Emergency First Aid/CPR and receive training in Mental Health First Aid, Positive Space, and scenario training. Security guards respond to immediate threats and de-escalate conflict situations. The Public Safety and Security Coordinators are licensed Private Investigators who conduct thorough investigations, manage risk, and monitor case developments. They are certified in Emergency Management, Threat Assessment, and Incident Management, among other qualifications. George Brown College has a strong relationship with Toronto Police Services, Ontario Provincial Police, and all City of Toronto emergency services to enhance campus safety.

Contact information:
- Phone number: 416-415-2000
- TTY number: 1-877-515-5559
- Email address: ask.george@georgebrown.ca

Note: The information contained in the website is subject to change without notice and should not be viewed as a representation, offer or warranty. Students are responsible for verifying George Brown College fee requirements.
